intro: Mnesiteon album, commonly known as the white mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and features soft, hairy leaves that are typically oval in shape. The plant produces showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Mnesiteon album is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance in garden settings.
